backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor serving as the backend canister entry point.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting the production deployment configuration with domain 'flappy-birds2025', linking to frontend/index.html and multiple components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON-formatted summaries of three frontend files describing the complete Flappy Bird game implementation with progressive speed mechanics and visual indicators.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with OKLCH color system defining CSS custom properties for light and dark themes, including sidebar, chart, and UI component colors.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for 'Flappy Birds 2025' with SEO meta tags, viewport configuration, and script reference to main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Complete Flappy Bird game component with canvas-based rendering, progressive speed multiplier that increases every 10 seconds, collision detection, pipe generation, and game state management.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook for managing ICP backend actor instances with authentication support, creating actors based on Internet Identity state and invalidating dependent queries on actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: React context provider and hook for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity persistence, and AuthClient lifecycle with configurable options.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base styles with OKLCH color variables for theming and custom keyframe animations (pulse-glow, slide-in) for the Flappy Bird speed indicator and notifications.
frontend/src/main.tsx: React application entry point wrapping App with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider for state management and authentication.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending the theme with OKLCH color system, custom animations (accordion-down/up), container settings, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project state tracking document listing three implemented features (progressive speed increase, visual feedback, production deployment) and one pending feature request for bird speed mechanics.
